page.title: 02GEOGRAPHICAL ASPECTS
page.content: In our DOMESDAY plot there are many hills and valleys, although they are not steep they cause a lot of inconvenience for the people who manage them.A prominent feature of the region's topography is a complex system of glacial drainage channels. Both the Gwaun valley and the Esgyrn regions show features of glaciation. The Gwaun valley shows a typically glacial feature of a "U" shaped valley, with a wide flood plain a misfit river and steep valley sides between 20 and 40 degrees,which are densely wooded. The Crinei brook valley also has a wide flood plain with a tiny brook meandering through it.The valley floor is very soft and is made up of layers of peat.The presence of reeds and other moisture loving plants is further evidence of the valley's swampy nature.
